attributes.comment:
To: US Citizenship and Immigration Services
Re: Docket number USCIS-2006-0044

My husband and I are in the process of adopting a child from China. We began
the lengthy paperwork process in July 2006. The process continues to slow down
more and more each day. When we first began working on the adoption, the wait
time was approximately 6 to 9 months from the date the paperwork is logged in to
China. Now, less than nine months later, we learn that the wait time has
increased to 15 or 16 months. This means that unless something changes
quickly, we will probably have to resubmit some of the CIS forms and redo our
fingerprints, which will result in even more fees and increased expenses to us as
we wait for our daughter.

Adopting internationally is already very expensive, especially since we will be
required to travel to China and stay two to three weeks. Please reconsider this
decision and do NOT raise the fees any higher than they already are. Also ?
anything that can be done to increase the length of time that I600/I600A forms are
valid to at least 24 months would be extremely helpful. We have no control over
the wait time ? and will probably be penalized simply because of what seems like
an arbitrary time limit on these forms.

Another problem we have encountered because of the extended wait time is that
we will lose the ability to deduct thousands of dollars in expenses on our income
taxes. We spent over $8,600 in 2006 on adoption expenses. When we finally
receive our daughter in 2008, we will only be able to deduct expenses from 2008
and 2007. It would be extremely helpful if a change could be made to the tax laws
to allow deductions for international adoptions from the previous two years prior to
the date the adoption is finalized.

The number of couples (and single persons) who are adopting internationally has
increased tremendously in the past few years. For various reasons, many of us
are unable to adopt in the U.S. and have chosen the more expensive international
adoption route and have had to make sacrifices to be able to afford it. Please do
not make this process any more difficult by increasing the expense of adopting.

Thank you for your consideration.

Nancy Cunningham

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Nancy Cunningham
